author: vors
body:
When you are working with a hierarchy of files where a lot of files have the same name, it's very easy to do the following mistake.

Let's say you want to call `Get-Content` (aka `cat`) on them.

```
ls -Recursive -Filter .gitignore | % {$_.FullName; cat $_}
```

This code is actually an equivalent to 

```
ls -Recursive -Filter .gitignore | % {$_.FullName; cat $_.Name}
```

And will output the same top-level `.gitignore` file again and again.
The way to fix it, would be changing to `$_ | cat` or `cat $_.FullName`.

It seems like one of the things that can introduce hard to spot bugs, but I don't know is it possible to improve without breaking existing scripts.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: If we add 'Path' alias for `FullName` in `FileInfo` will the binding work well?

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
@iSazonov - an alias parameter would only help when binding via the pipeline.

We could add an argument transformation attribute though - that wouldn't change behavior anywhere it wasn't used.  The transformation would do nothing for strings, use `FullName` for FileInfo or DirectoryInfo instances, and I guess use whatever conversion we do today for everything else, probably calling `LanguagePrimitives.ConvertTo<string>` or something like that.

title: Get-Content on FileInfo behave un-intuitive
